Komisi Yudisial Kantongi 13 Nama Calon Hakim Agung 2019
05 Nov 2019, 23:58 by Denisa Tristianty


Komisi Yudisial Kantongi 13 Nama Calon Hakim Agung 2019

Jakarta, KBRN : Komisi Yudisial (KY) sudah mengantongi 13 nama calon Hakim Agung (CHA). Mereka lolos seleksi tahap III, yaitu seleksi kesehatan dan kepribadian di Gedung KY, Jakarta Pusat, Selasa (5/11/2019).
"Penetapan kelulusan tersebut ditetapkan dalam Rapat Pleno KY CHA Tahun 2019," kata Ketua Bidang Rekrutmen Hakim KY, Aidul Fitriciada Azhari seperti dilansir pers rilis resmi KY yang diterima rri.co.id  pada Selasa (5/11/2019) malam.
Para CHA, lanjut dia, akan melanjutkan seleksi wawancara, pada Selasa-Kamis, 12-14 November 2019 di Gedung KY, Jakarta.
"Dalam seleksi wawancara, CHA akan digali lebih mendalam mengenai visi, misi, dan komitmen, Kode Etik dan Pedoman Perilaku Hakim (KEPPH), filsafat hukum dan teori hukum,"tegas dia.
Selain itu, 13 CHA juga akan diwawancarai mengenai wawasan pengetahuan peradilan dan perkembangan hukum, serta penguasaan hukum materiil dan formil. Aidul mengatakan 13 CHA berasal dari jalur karier dan non-karier.
"Dari jalur karier sebanyak 12 orang dan jalur non-karier sebanyak 1 orang. Itu terdiri dari sebelas laki-laki, dan hanya ada dua perempuan untuk CHA kali ini,"ungkapnya.
Tiga belas CHA itu datang dari 10 orang berprofesi hakim, 1 orang berprofesi akademisi, dan 2 orang berprofesi hakim pajak.
"Berdasarkan kategori pendidikan, sebanyak 7 orang bergelar doktor dan 6 orang lainnya bergelar magister," kata dia.
Aidul menjelaskan, berdasarkan jenis kamar yang dipilih itu terdapat 2 orang dari kamar Agama, 4 orang dari kamar Perdata,  2 orang dari kamar Pidana, 3 orang dari kamar Militer, dan 2 orang dari kamar Tata Usaha Negara, khusus pajak.
Sedangkan menurut KY, seleksi CHA ini untuk menjaring hanya delapan Hakim Agung. 
"Tiga orang untuk kamar Pidana, satu orang untuk kamar Agama, dua orang untuk kamar Militer, empat rang untuk kamar Perdata, dan satu orang untuk kamar Tata Usaha Negara khusus pajak,"tegasnya. (Foto: Komisi Yudisial)

Kantongi Judicial Commission 13 Name of Prospective Chief Justice 2019
05 Nov 2019, 23:58 by Denisa Tristianty


Kantongi Judicial Commission 13 Name of Prospective Chief Justice 2019

Jakarta, KBRN: Judicial Commission (KY) has pocketed 13 names of candidates for Chief Justice (CHA). They passed the Phase III selection, namely the selection of health and personality in the KY Building, Central Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
"The determination of the graduation was determined in the KY CHA Plenary Meeting in 2019," said KY Judge Recruitment Chief Aidul Fitriciada Azhari as reported by KY's official press release received by rri.co.id on Tuesday (11/05/2019) night.
The CHA, he continued, will continue the interview selection, on Tuesday-Thursday, November 12-14, 2019 at KY Building, Jakarta.
"In the interview selection, the CHA will be explored more deeply about the vision, mission and commitment, the Code of Ethics and the Code of Conduct for Judges (KEPPH), legal philosophy and legal theory," he stressed.
In addition, 13 CHAs will also be interviewed regarding insight into judicial knowledge and legal developments, as well as mastery of material and formal law. Aidul said 13 CHAs came from career and non-career paths.
"From the career path of 12 people and the non-career path of 1 person. It consists of eleven men, and there are only two women for the CHA this time," he said.
Thirteen CHAs came from 10 judges, 1 academic and 2 tax judges.
"Based on the education category, as many as 7 people hold doctorates and 6 others hold masters degrees," he said.
Aidul explained, based on the type of room chosen there were 2 people from the Religious room, 4 people from the Civil room, 2 people from the Criminal room, 3 people from the Military room, and 2 people from the State Administration room, specifically tax.
Meanwhile, according to KY, the CHA selection to solicit only eight Supreme Court Justices.
"Three people for Criminal rooms, one person for Religious rooms, two people for Military rooms, four people for Civil rooms, and one person for State Administration special tax room," he said. (Photo: Judicial Commission)
